oai_dc:dc.dc:title: League to Enforce Peace convention invitation to Governor Rye
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An invitation given to Governor Rye from former president William Howard Taft. The invitation is for a convention that the League is hosting in order to "sustain the determination of our people to fight until Prussian militarism has been defeated." Also mentioned are accusations against Germany for spreading pacifism in the United States.

The League to Enforce Peace was an international organization established in 1915 for the purpose of promoting an international body for world peace. Former president William Howard Taft served as the League's president. In 1919, the League pushed for and supported Woodrow Wilson's League of Nations. Operations ended by 1923.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: League to Enforce Peace
